comment: Took this professor at GGC ! books for essays will have to be purchased or you can just look it up ! Hard to read with feedback , will respond back to emails effeciently, work is grouped into 7 weeks but assignments span for literal weeks, that is a plus . he expects essays so be weary, there is a lot of resources he gives!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Look he isn't a professor that goes out of his way to make his class hard. There are 5 tests that are open note/book with ALL THE ANSWERS in articles he has given. (Which are listed for you to go back on) Lowest grade gets dropped for the test. A few discussion posts & writing assignments with blue books and a take home essay for midterm & final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: Expects you to squeeze blood from a stone for reflections and essays. You're not allowed to use outside sources for anything. He'll actually take off points if you do. How are you supposed to come up with an original thought if you're not allowed to reference anything that wasn't in the lectures or required readings?
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Pidhainy's lectures can drag and are boring, but his class is easy. We had a few quizzes and discussions. Most grades were completion, but the ones that are not were graded pretty easy. He cares a lot about teaching, and I would recommend him for a easy core class.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: I took this class online. It consisted of a LOT of reading. There were maybe 4 books we had to purchase and read as part of the Reflections. Those were very hard considering these books are "old-timey". Multiple group projects which were fairly easy. Professor responds to emails super fast and will extend due dates if needed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Online Savvy

comment: This class was awful and lectures were boring. The midterm and final determine your grade. We did 2 group projects the first one was pretty easy but the second one was almost impossible. Midterm and final are 10 paragraph papers. He grades so hard on the papers and didn't give me feedback when I didn't do well. Read 5 books. 10 quizzes worth little
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a nice guy but his lectures are totally useless and unrelated to anything you're actually tested on. As long as you read the textbook before your tests you will get an A.

comment: Don't take this professor unless you love history. He requires essays on topics that are so obscure and the prompts just don't make sense. Save yourself the stress and take a different professor.

comment: His quizzes require the textbook while doing the quiz. His tests are just papers and he will tell you with 2 days in advance to write a 3 page paper. comment: Multiple chapters and books a week, discussion posts with three replies and reflections. Sort of off-topic and MULTIPLE group projects, which is exceedingly tricky online. He will not accept late work, but he does drop your two lowest quiz grades.

comment: Class is off topic, but people make him out to be worse than he is. It's easy good grades, and while it required to attend class, you can work on homework and assignments from other classes. comment: Very lecture-heavy, but posts slides and summaries to d2l for anyone who was absent or who needs to refer to them later. In-class discussion is always interesting. Some reading is required, but nothing too heavy or deep. He is very willing to work with struggling students and offers extra credit often. Also offers extensions. Take him if you can!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: 3-4 written essays per test. Points off for the smallest spelling errors. Will not answer emails nor questions asked in persons. Will put you through a semester of stress&agony since lectures dont follow tests. Avoid at all costs; save yourself the stress for what should have been a simple history class ( coming from a 4.0 student)

comment: lectures stray off topic; they don't matter in regards to quizzes and exams yet count towards your participation grade. exams are pure writing and his grading system seems fair yet is not. you'll receive an 83 on a reflection for misspelling a term seen in the reading or on an essay he claims is "well written." tough grader and provides no feedback

comment: The professor was really nice and cracked a couple of dad jokes here and there! You could tell that he really liked talking about history, and he made the lectures interesting to listen to.
